metadata.name: Nameless Bird
metadata.description:
There's a market where fresh fish are sold. On ordinary days, we shopped there. This bird appeared, curious, and different from the rest-- a reminder that magic and memory is everywhere, even in the most common scenes. Whether laundry hanging on a wire, or the particular shade of blue in the sky: poetry is around us constantly, if we pause to feel to it. 

This is my genesis piece, as  Seed Poet, with much light to come. 

The poem: 

I threw rocks at your bird
but they never connected 

You scolded me
constantly

"That bird is an ancestor
 come back to haunt us" 

This nameless bird
perched in silence
there everyday 

 a statue above the street
where children play,
and drunks walk alone 
making their own bird 
noises 


once i touched his 
beak 
colder than I imagined 
and much more fragile 

##
Special thanks to @omid_kzemi for adding magic
